intro: Sorocea bonplandii, commonly known as the Bonpland's sorocea, is a rare and unique plant species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their diverse forms and ecological roles. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaf morphology, which aid in its survival in high-altitude environments. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sorocea bonplandii is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
